title: Fort Minor
text:
{{Short description|Hip hop side project of Mike Shinoda}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2022}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Fort Minor | image = Concert of Mike Shinoda at the Zénith de Paris IMG 20190309 220847 (46437817175).jpg | caption = Mike Shinoda performing in 2019 | image_size = | origin = Los Angeles, California, U.S. | genre = {{hlist|[[Alternative hip hop]]|[[rap rock]]{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6613285/beck-leads-adult-alternative-fort-minor-disturbed-return|title=Beck Leads Adult Alternative, Fort Minor & Disturbed Return to Charts|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] }}}} | years_active = {{hlist|2004–2006|2015–2017}} | label = {{hlist|[[Machine Shop Recordings|Machine Shop]]|[[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]]}} | website = {{URL|fortminor.com}} | past_members = [[Mike Shinoda]] }} '''Fort Minor''' was a [[hip hop music|hip hop]] [[side project]] by American musician [[Mike Shinoda]], who is better known as the rhythm guitarist, keyboardist, producer, and rapper of the [[rock music|rock]] band [[Linkin Park]]. The project's only album, ''[[The Rising Tied]]'', was released in 2005. The album's fourth single "[[Where'd You Go (Fort Minor song)|Where'd You Go]]" reached No. 4 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].{{cite web|access-date=2010-10-07|work=[[Billboard.com]]|publisher=Billboard|title=Where'd You Go – Fort Minor (Chart History)|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=fort minor|chart=all}}}} == History == === Formation and ''The Rising Tied'' (2004–2006) === Mike Shinoda created Fort Minor in 2004. Shinoda uses the name Fort Minor for his collaborations with Ryan Patrick Maginn (Ryu) and Takbir Bashir (Tak), who themselves hail from the underground hip hop group [[Styles of Beyond]]. Shinoda began recording songs for this side project following the release of [[Collision Course (EP)|Collision Course]] in November 2004.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1497764/03042005/shinoda_mike.jhtml|title=Mike Shinoda's Solo Album May Divide Linkin Park Fans|last=Montgomery|first=James|date=March 4, 2005|publisher=MTV News|access-date=December 27, 2008}} ''[[Fort Minor: We Major]]'' was a [[mixtape]] by Shinoda and [[DJ Green Lantern]] to promote his upcoming studio album. ''[[The Rising Tied]]'', the debut album of Fort Minor, was released in November 2005. Robert Hales directed its first video "[[Petrified/Remember the Name|Petrified]]", which was released the previous month.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1511882/20051020/fort_minor.jhtml|title=Linkin Park MC Gets Director With Flair For Video With Flares|last=Moss|first=Corey|date=October 20, 2005|publisher=MTV News|access-date=December 27, 2008}} [[Jay-Z]], who had previously collaborated with Linkin Park on the 2004 album ''[[Collision Course (EP)|Collision Course]]'', was the executive producer for ''[[The Rising Tied]]''.{{cite web|last=Loftus|first=Johnny|title=Fort Minor – Biography|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p743642|pure_url=yes}}|work=Allmusic|year=2006|access-date=June 18, 2008}} Shinoda told Corey Moss of [[MTV News]] that he imposed on himself a requirement to play all the instruments and write all the lyrics to the album except for the strings, percussion, or choir parts.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/f/fort_minor/qa_112105/ |title=Mike Shinoda: Storyteller |last=Moss |first=Corey |date=November 22, 2005 |publisher=MTV News |access-date=December 27, 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080430121243/http://www.mtv.com/bands/f/fort_minor/qa_112105/ |archive-date=April 30, 2008 }} "[[Where'd You Go (Fort Minor song)|Where'd You Go]]", its fourth single, peaked at No. 4 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 chart, while second single, "[[Petrified/Remember the Name|Remember the Name]]", reached at No. 66.{{cite web|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p743642|pure_url=yes}}|title=Fort Minor > Charts & Awards|website=allmusic|access-date=December 27, 2008}} Another track, "Kenji" describes the experiences of a Japanese-American family during the [[Japanese American internment]] of [[World War II]].{{cite web|url={{AllMusic|class=album|id=r804745|pure_url=yes}}|title=The Rising Tied > Overview|last=Jeffries|first=David|date=November 22, 2005|website=allmusic|access-date=December 27, 2008}} Due to the success of "Where'd You Go" during the week of April 26, 2006, sales of ''The Rising Tied'' increased by 45 percent, and the album chart position went up 89 positions to No. 104 on the ''Billboard'' 200."{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1529510/20060426/t_i_.jhtml|title=T.I., Pink, Shakira Can't Shake Rascal Flatts From Billboard #1|last=Harris|first=Chris|date=April 26, 2006|publisher=MTV News|access-date=December 27, 2008}} Where'd You Go" was awarded Ringtone of the Year at the [[2006 MTV Video Music Awards]]. In mid-August 2006, Fort Minor performed at the [[Summer Sonic]] 2006 alongside [[Linkin Park]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/104924/ringtone-of-the-year.jhtml#id=1539042|title=Ringtone of the Year|date=September 2, 2006|publisher=MTV|access-date=December 27, 2008}} The third track on the album, "Right Now", is featured in the trailer of ''[[The Family That Preys]]'' by Tyler Perry.{{Cite web|title=FORT MINOR: The Other Side Of Music {{!}} Visionary Artistry Magazine |url=http://visionaryartistrymag.com/2011/02/fort-minor-the-other-side-of-music/ |date=May 8, 2013 |access-date=2015-06-23 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508083958/http://visionaryartistrymag.com/2011/02/fort-minor-the-other-side-of-music/ |archive-date=May 8, 2013 }} The song "[[Petrified/Remember the Name|Remember the Name]]" was used in promotional TV trailers for the 2006 movie ''[[Gridiron Gang]]'', as well as the trailer for the remake of the movie ''[[The Karate Kid (2010)|The Karate Kid]]'', an episode in the second season of TV show ''[[Numb3rs]]'', and the film ''[[The Smurfs 2]]''. The song also received attention on HBO's [[Hard Knocks (2001 TV series)|Hard Knocks]], where NFL star [[J.J. Watt]] was filmed rapping the song during a workout.{{cite web | url=https://www.tmz.com/2022/02/16/jj-watt-trolls-himself-remember-the-name-rap-hard-knocks/ | title=J.J. Watt Trolls Himself over Infamous 'Remember the Name' Rap from 'Hard Knocks' }} === Indefinite hiatus (2006–2015) === In November 2006, Fort Minor released a video for "Where'd You Go". Shinoda has stated he felt the video was a nice wrap-up for Fort Minor. Also in November, Shinoda stated that Fort Minor was currently on hiatus, because of his dedication to [[Linkin Park]]. In 2006, [[Skylar Grey]] released an exclusive version of "Where'd You Go" to radio stations, made by herself. Mike does not appear on this version.{{Cite web|title=Fort Minor Unofficial: Where'd Mike Go? |url=http://fortminor.co.uk/2006/09/whered-mike-go.html |date=March 20, 2009 |access-date=2015-06-23 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090320232054/http://fortminor.co.uk/2006/09/whered-mike-go.html |archive-date=March 20, 2009 }} In the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' One-hit Wonders of the 2000s, Fort Minor (along with Holly Brook and Jonah Matranga) were listed at No. 19, due to the success of "Where'd You Go" (since it was Fort Minor's only single that reached the top 25).{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266486/one-hit-wonders-of-the-2000s-page-2 |title=One-Hit Wonders of the 2000s |year=2009 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=July 22, 2011}} In an LPU Chat in early 2012, Mike Shinoda said there is a possibility for a new Fort Minor album after Linkin Park's sixth studio album, which was planned for release in 2014. In October 2013, on the Nick Catchdubs remix of Linkin Park's "[[Living Things (Linkin Park album)|Skin to Bone]]", Ryu from Styles of Beyond stated that Fort Minor's mission isn't over, hinting at a second studio album. === "Welcome" single (2015) and second hiatus === On June 21, 2015, Shinoda released a new, non-album single titled "[[Welcome (Fort Minor song)|Welcome]]".{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/mikeshinoda/status/612847063898853376|title=Mike Shinoda on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=June 23, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/fortminor/status/612849100099223552|title=Fort Minor on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=June 23, 2015}} Fort Minor also appeared as the musical guest on the [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] late-night talk show ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' on June 22, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://teamcoco.com/schedule/2015-06-22/monday/fort-minor|title=Conan Show Guests Schedule: June 22 – 25, 2015 @ TeamCoco.com|work=teamcoco.com|access-date=June 23, 2015|archive-date=2015-06-22|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150622104909/http://teamcoco.com/schedule/2015-06-22/monday/fort-minor|url-status=dead}} No new announcement has been made and the future of Fort Minor is currently unknown. However, ever since [[Chester Bennington]]'s suicide on July 20, 2017, Shinoda has been performing and releasing songs as a solo act under his real name. === Status of Fort Minor (2020) === In September 2020, Shinoda addressed the status of Fort Minor on the podcast ''The Green Room with Neil Griffiths'', saying "I'm Fort Minor the way [[Trent Reznor]] is [[Nine Inch Nails]]. Like, Nine Inch Nails is a group effort, but if Trent doesn't do it, it's not a thing."{{cite web |url=https://thepodcasts.com.au/green-room-with-neil-griffiths |title=The Green Room With Neil Griffiths – Mike Shinoda |last=Griffiths |first=Neil |publisher=Handshake Media Pty Ltd. |date=September 10, 2020 |website=thePodcasts.com.au |access-date=April 24, 2021}} He added that there is "no answer" about what's next for Fort Minor. "With Fort Minor I brought different people in to do different things and had some amazing features. I still believe that one of [[Black Thought]]'s best verses of all time is on ''Right Now'' on the Fort Minor record and it just happens to be on my record. That would have been one my favourite verses he's ever done whether or not it was for that record. For me, there's a bit of a high bar. I don't know why."{{cite web |url=https://themusic.com.au/news/fort-minor-mike-shinoda-green-room-podcast-neil-griffiths/hVedmZibmp0/14-09-20/ |title='There's A Bit Of A High Bar': Mike Shinoda Reveals Status Of Fort Minor |last=Griffiths |first=Neil |publisher=Handshake Media Pty Ltd. |date=September 13, 2020 |website=theMusic.com.au |access-date=April 24, 2021}} == Discography == === Studio albums === {|class="wikitable" !rowspan="2" width="2"|Year !rowspan="2" width="250"|Title !colspan="9"|Peak chart Positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:12em;" | [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- !style="width:3em;font-size:80%"|[[Billboard 200|US]]

(featuring [[Skylar Grey|Holly Brook]] & [[Jonah Matranga]]) | rowspan="2"| 2006 | 4 || 41 || 29 || 8 || 24 || 18 || 15 || 14 || 62 || — | * RIAA: Platinum |- ! scope="row"| "S.C.O.M. / Dolla / Get It / Spraypaint & Ink Pens" (Promo CD)
("S.C.O.M." performed by Ryu featuring [[Juelz Santana]] & [[Celph Titled]] / "Dolla" performed by Fort Minor featuring Styles of Beyond / "Get It" performed by Styles of Beyond / "Spraypaint & Inkpens" performed by [[Ghostface Killah]] featuring Mike Shinoda and [[Lupe Fiasco]]) | — || — || — || — || — || — || — || — || — || — | | ''Fort Minor: We Major'' |- ! scope="row"| "[[Welcome (Fort Minor song)|Welcome]]" | 2015 |— |— |— |— |— |— |— |— |— |— | |{{n/a|Non-album single}} |- |colspan="14" style="font-size:90%"| "—" denotes a recording that did not chart or was not released in that territory. |} === Fort Minor Militia exclusive tracks === ''Militia'' is the debut studio EP for the Fort Minor's official fan club, known as the "Fort Minor Militia". Subscribers were given exclusive tracks for digital download that were never officially released with the exception of "Kenji (Interview Version)" and "Believe Me (Club Remix)", which were later released to Linkin Park and Styles of Beyond's official websites respectively. These tracks are sometimes referred to as the ''Fort Minor Militia EP''. {|class="wikitable" |- !Date !Title |- |align="center"|November 2005 |"Do What We Did" (Demo) (featuring Styles of Beyond) |- |align="center"|December 2005 |"Kenji" (Interview Version) |- |align="center"|January 2006 |"Tools of the Trade" (Demo) (featuring Styles of Beyond & Celph Titled) |- |align="center"|February 2006 |"Where'd You Joe?" ("[[Where'd You Go (Fort Minor song)|Where'd You Go]]" Remix by [[Joe Hahn|Mr. Hahn]]) (featuring Holly Brook) |- |align="center"|April 2006 |"Believe Me" (Club Remix) (featuring Eric Bobo & Styles of Beyond) |- |align="center"|May 2006 |"Start It All Up" (Demo) |- |align="center"|June 2006 |"Move On" (Demo) (featuring Mr. Hahn) |} === Music videos === {|class="wikitable" |- !Date !Title !Director |- |align="center" rowspan="1"|January 12, 2005 |"Petrified" |[[Robert Hales (director)|Robert Hales]] |- |align="center" rowspan="1"|February 26, 2005 |"Remember the Name" |[[Kimo Proudfoot]] |- |align="center" rowspan="1"|December 12, 2005 |"Believe Me" |Laurent Briet |- |align="center" rowspan="1"|May 29, 2006 |"Where'd You Go" |[[Philip Andelman]] |- |align="center" rowspan="1"|June 22, 2015 |"Welcome" |Jeff Nicholas |} == Awards and nominations == ; [[MTV Video Music Awards]] {| class="wikitable" style="width:80%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:30%;"| Award ! style="width:30%;"| Nomination ! style="width:10%;"| Result |- |[[2006 MTV Video Music Awards|2006]] |[[MTV Video Music Award for Ringtone of the Year|Ringtone of the Year]] |"Where'd You Go" (featuring [[Holly Brook]]) |{{won}} |} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.fortminor.com/ Official website] *{{allMusic}} {{Fort Minor}} {{Mike Shinoda}} {{Linkin Park}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:American hip hop groups]] [[Category:Musical groups from Los Angeles]] [[Category:Linkin Park]] [[Category:Warner Records artists]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2004]] [[Category:Alternative hip hop groups]] [[Category:Rap rock groups]]
